on Sunday. Media reports during Egypt's political unrest had quoted Zahi Hawass as saying that looters damaged two mummies, but in a BBC interview on Sunday he said that this was not the case. They were not mummies, there were two skulls taken outside from the CT scan machine. Everything will go back to normal at Cairo Museum today, said Zahi Hawass , head of Egypt's antiquities authority since 2002. He was made a cabinet minister last week. Our strong performance has been driven by a rapidly growing digital economy, continuous product innovation that benefits both users and advertisers, and by the extraordinary momentum of our newer businesses, such as display and mobile, Mr. Eric Schmidt said in a statement.
